greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numbers of the form q*(2^k), where q is one of the Mersenne primes (A000668) and k >= 0.
comment: Numbers of the form 2^k * ((2^p)-1), where p is one of the primes in A000043, and k >= 0.
Numbers k such that A000265(k) is in A000668.
Numbers k that themselves are not powers of two, but for which A335876(k) = k+A052126(k) is [a power of 2].
Conjecture: This sequence gives all the fixed points of map A332214 (and its inverse A332215).
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: qs = 2^MersennePrimeExponent[Range[6]] - 1; max = qs[[-1]]; Reap[Do[n = 2^k*q; If[n <= max, Sow[n]], {k, 0, Log2[max]}, {q, qs}]][[2, 1]] // Union (* _Amiram Eldar_, Feb 18 2021 *)
xref: Cf. A000043, A000396 (even terms form a subsequence), A000668 (primes present), A331410, A335882.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jun 28 2020
